data.title: Porsche IMSA GT3 Cup Challenge by Yokohama - Races 10 & 11, Road America 2012
data.description: The Porsche IMSA GT3 Cup Challenge by Yokohama features drivers racing in the largest single-make series in North America. Powered by one of the world's most successful race cars, the Porsche 911 GT3 Cup Type 997, the multi-class structure of this series teaches drivers essential skills for a career in the American Le Mans Series. The 2012 GT3 Cup races at the 4 mile Elkhart Lake road course challenge the Platinum and Gold class racers like no other track can.

data.title: How To Drive a Fast Lap of Sebring - /SHAKEDOWN
data.description: Leo Parente, host of ShakeDown, shares track notes of how to drive the Sebring 12hr race course.  With the help of racers he has known, an interview with 2012 winner - Allan McNish, and an in-car lap that Madison Snow drove in his Platinum Class Porsche IMSA GT3 Cup Challenge by Yokohama racecar, ShakeDown breaks down the 3.7 mile track, corner by corner.  If you like, we can do more tracks as part of the ShakeDown University racer skills training series.

data.title: King of Speed: 3.5L V6 EcoBoost Has Record-Setting Day in Daytona
data.description:
Breaking FIA world speed records that have stood since 1979, along with one of racing's hallowed marks, the Daytona International Speedway single lap closed course record, is no easy task. 

But Michael Shank Racing, the Roush Yates 3.5L V6 EcoBoost engine, Continental Tire, Daytona International Speedway and many more helped Ford Racing etch October 9, 2013 in the record books.

data.title: Deuces Wild: A 222 MPH Lap Around Daytona International Speedway
data.description: Colin Braun took a 3.5L V6 EcoBoost engine 222 MPH around Daytona International Speedway inside a Michael Shank Racing Daytona Prototype. Hang on. It's faster than any man has ever driven around Daytona.

data.title: How Carroll Shelby Beat Enzo Ferrari -- /ROAD TESTAMENT
data.description: Road Testament digs into the amazing story of how the late Carroll Shelby helped Ford unseat Enzo Ferrari as the king of sports-car racing during the mid-1960s. With special guest A.J. Baime, author of "Go Like Hell: Ford, Ferrari and Their Battle For Speed and Glory at Le Mans."

data.title: Behind the Scenes: The Fastest Lotus GT Race Car - /SHAKEDOWN
data.description: Leo Parente and ShakeDown travel to the American Le Mans Series Mosport GP, before heading right to the Spa24 and more GT racing. The Lotus Evora GT of Alex Job Racing in the 2012 ALMS gets an up-close look and discussion. OMG, is this Lotus Racing program going well, just a paint job, or the Lotus Indy mess with fenders?

data.title: Secret Ford Race Cars - /SHAKEDOWN
data.description:
Leo Parente and /ShakeDown kick-start a list of Ford race cars that were not in the limelight like the Ford GT, the Lotus-Ford F1 and Indy cars, Ken Block Fiestas, NASCAR Fords, RS200 Group B, and others. Ford Racing spawned so many other projects and prototypes. Not always successful [otherwise they would have been famous], but definitely interesting, despite all the secrecy.

And when the show is finished, YOU add to the Secret Ford Race Cars list, because you know you know things Leo does not know!


http://youtu.be/l5u0q2XkXC0
These Are The Worst Fords In History. Sorry Henry -- AFTER/DRIVE

data.title: US Lawn Mower Racing Finals
data.description: Lawn mower racing is one of the last affordable action sports. Lawn mower racers know the value of good filtration, that is why K&N is nearly everywhere on the track. K&N caught up with these weekend warriors at the 17th Annual STA-BIL Nationals in Delaware, Ohio at the Delaware County Fairgrounds.

data.title: KRÜGSPEED Lotus - How 'Fast' Happens Part 1- /SHAKEDOWN
data.description:
Alex Krugman and his KRÜGSPEED team build Lotus Exige racecars. Leo Parente and /ShakeDown visit the team at Lime Rock Park [home of the Skip Barber Racing School - where Leo learned to race] to catch up on team preparations for the SCCA Runoffs and to drive the Supercharged Lotus Exige racecar [on the track Leo last raced all the way back in 1992!]. This show, Part 1, takes a behind-the-scenes look at the KRÜGSPEED team, the car, and what it's like to race at the higher levels of amateur competition.

Part 2 Leo takes the Lotus on track.

asset.author: /DRIVE

data.title: KRÜGSPEED Lotus - How 'Fast' Happens Part 2 - /SHAKEDOWN
data.description:
It's time for Leo Parente to drive the supercharged KRÜGSPEED Lotus Exige race car at Lime Rock Park. 

Alex Krugman and his team were there to shakedown his 2 Lotus in advance of their trip to the SCCA National Runoffs. So, Leo had to drive smart and be respectful of the team's bigger priorities vs /ShakeDown getting some video footage. No curb-hopping or power drifts. But, that doesn't mean the Lotus didn't go quick enough to pass a few cars. Even with a lower than max redline as a new motor was being brought up to race condition.‎

After the run, Leo and the KRÜGSPEED racers - David Brand and Elivan Goulart share track notes on how to get around Lime Rock fast.

data.title: Stadium Super Trucks: Excellent Madness - /MOMO SlowMo
data.description:
Jumping, sliding, crashing (gently), who wouldn't want to do that? Robby Gordon wanted to do all of those, in one race.

We love Robby Gordon. 

But that race didn't exist. 


So Robby created his own racing series:  the SPEED Energy Formula Off-Road (AKA "Stadium Super Trucks"), and it's one of the most amazing races ever held for 4-wheeled vehicles. Lap after lap, trucks fly to big heights and round corners in smoky slides, there's bumping and torn body panels and screaming tires. 


But with so much going on, some times it's easy to get overwhelmed, so we're slowing things down, and giving it the /MOMO SlowMo treatment. Now you can savor all 24" of suspension compression, and every smoking second.

data.title: Mercedes Benz Racing
data.description: Tensions are high as Tomas Enge, a professional Indy Racing League driver, prepares to drive the Mercedes Benz CLK in the DTM (Deutsche Tourenwagen Meisterschaft) German Touring Car series. Conditions are poor as heavy rain falls upon the track. The 3-hour race will require the utmost of concentration and delicate handling by the drivers as they contend with slick on-track conditions, tight corners, and a grid of nearly fifty vehicles pushing the limits of grip for a first place finish.

data.title: The Porsche 918 Spyder Tested  - CHRIS HARRIS ON CARS
data.tags: Porsche 918 Spyder, test drive, Chris Harris, /Drive
data.description:
The plug-in hybrid, mid-engine hypercar: The Porsche 918 Spyder.

Tested by /DRIVE's Chris Harris at the Valencia circuit in the winter of 2013.  The Porsche 918 Spyder has come a long way since when we first saw it at the Geneva Motor Show in March 2010.   Competing against the Ferrari LaFerrari and McLaren P1, it is the cheapest of the trio of new hypercars at a base price of $845,000. 

The engine weights 140 kg according to Porsche and it delivers 608 horsepower (453 kW) at 8,500 rpm and 528 N·m (389 lbf·ft) of maximum torque. This is supplemented by two electric motors delivering an additional 279 hp (208 kW) - One 154 hp electric motor drives the rear wheels in parallel with the engine and also serves as the main generator.
